speaker: LANCELET
text: Certainly my conscience will serve me to

speaker: LANCELET
text: run from this Jew my master. The fiend is at mine

speaker: LANCELET
text: elbow and tempts me, saying to me “Gobbo,

speaker: LANCELET
text: Lancelet Gobbo, good Lancelet,” or “good Gobbo,”

speaker: LANCELET
text: or “good Lancelet Gobbo, use your legs, take

speaker: LANCELET
text: the start, run away.” My conscience says “No. Take

speaker: LANCELET
text: heed, honest Lancelet, take heed, honest Gobbo,”

speaker: LANCELET
text: or, as aforesaid, “honest Lancelet Gobbo, do not

speaker: LANCELET
text: run; scorn running with thy heels.” Well, the most

speaker: LANCELET
text: courageous fiend bids me pack. “Fia!” says the

speaker: LANCELET
text: fiend. “Away!” says the fiend. “For the heavens,

speaker: LANCELET
text: rouse up a brave mind,” says the fiend, “and run!”

speaker: LANCELET
text: Well, my conscience, hanging about the neck of my

speaker: LANCELET
text: heart, says very wisely to me “My honest friend

speaker: LANCELET
text: Lancelet, being an honest man’s son”—or rather,

speaker: LANCELET
text: an honest woman’s son, for indeed my father did

speaker: LANCELET
text: something smack, something grow to—he had a

speaker: LANCELET
text: kind of taste—well, my conscience says “Lancelet,

speaker: LANCELET
text: budge not.” “Budge,” says the fiend. “Budge not,”

speaker: LANCELET
text: says my conscience. “Conscience,” say I, “you

speaker: LANCELET
text: counsel well.” “Fiend,” say I, “you counsel well.”

speaker: LANCELET
text: To be ruled by my conscience, I should stay with the

speaker: LANCELET
text: Jew my master, who (God bless the mark) is a kind

speaker: LANCELET
text: of devil; and to run away from the Jew, I should be

speaker: LANCELET
text: ruled by the fiend, who (saving your reverence) is

speaker: LANCELET
text: the devil himself. Certainly the Jew is the very devil

speaker: LANCELET
text: incarnation, and, in my conscience, my conscience

speaker: LANCELET
text: is but a kind of hard conscience to offer to counsel

speaker: LANCELET
text: me to stay with the Jew. The fiend gives the more

speaker: LANCELET
text: friendly counsel. I will run, fiend. My heels are at

speaker: LANCELET
text: your commandment. I will run.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Master young man, you, I pray you, which is

speaker: GOBBO
text: the way to Master Jew’s?

speaker: LANCELET
text: O heavens, this is my true begotten

speaker: LANCELET
text: father, who being more than sandblind, high gravelblind,

speaker: LANCELET
text: knows me not. I will try confusions with him.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Master young gentleman, I pray you, which is

speaker: GOBBO
text: the way to Master Jew’s?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Turn up on your right hand at the next

speaker: LANCELET
text: turning, but at the next turning of all on your left;

speaker: LANCELET
text: marry, at the very next turning, turn of no hand,

speaker: LANCELET
text: but turn down indirectly to the Jew’s house.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Be God’s sonties, ’twill be a hard way to hit.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Can you tell me whether one Lancelet, that dwells

speaker: GOBBO
text: with him, dwell with him or no?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Talk you of young Master Lancelet?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Mark me now, now will I raise the waters.—Talk

speaker: LANCELET
text: you of young Master Lancelet?

speaker: GOBBO
text: No master, sir, but a poor man’s son. His

speaker: GOBBO
text: father, though I say ’t, is an honest exceeding poor

speaker: GOBBO
text: man and, God be thanked, well to live.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Well, let his father be what he will, we talk

speaker: LANCELET
text: of young Master Lancelet.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Your Worship’s friend, and Lancelet, sir.

speaker: LANCELET
text: But I pray you, ergo, old man, ergo, I beseech

speaker: LANCELET
text: you, talk you of young Master Lancelet?

speaker: GOBBO
text: Of Lancelet, an ’t please your mastership.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Ergo, Master Lancelet. Talk not of Master

speaker: LANCELET
text: Lancelet, father, for the young gentleman, according

speaker: LANCELET
text: to Fates and Destinies, and such odd sayings, the

speaker: LANCELET
text: Sisters Three, and such branches of learning, is

speaker: LANCELET
text: indeed deceased, or, as you would say in plain

speaker: LANCELET
text: terms, gone to heaven.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Marry, God forbid! The boy was the very staff

speaker: GOBBO
text: of my age, my very prop.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Do I look like a cudgel or a hovel-post,

speaker: LANCELET
text: a staff or a prop?—Do you know me, father?

speaker: GOBBO
text: Alack the day, I know you not, young gentleman.

speaker: GOBBO
text: But I pray you tell me, is my boy, God rest his

speaker: GOBBO
text: soul, alive or dead?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Do you not know me, father?

speaker: GOBBO
text: Alack, sir, I am sandblind. I know you not.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Nay, indeed, if you had your eyes, you might

speaker: LANCELET
text: fail of the knowing me. It is a wise father that

speaker: LANCELET
text: knows his own child. Well, old man, I will tell you

speaker: LANCELET
text:
news of your son.
                 
                He
                 
                kneels
                .
               Give me your blessing.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Truth will come to light, murder cannot be hid

speaker: LANCELET
text: long—a man’s son may, but in the end, truth will

speaker: LANCELET
text: out.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Pray you, sir, stand up! I am sure you are not

speaker: GOBBO
text: Lancelet my boy.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Pray you, let’s have no more fooling about

speaker: LANCELET
text: it, but give me your blessing. I am Lancelet, your

speaker: LANCELET
text: boy that was, your son that is, your child that shall

speaker: LANCELET
text: be.

speaker: GOBBO
text: I cannot think you are my son.

speaker: LANCELET
text: I know not what I shall think of that; but I

speaker: LANCELET
text: am Lancelet, the Jew’s man, and I am sure Margery

speaker: LANCELET
text: your wife is my mother.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Her name is Margery, indeed. I’ll be sworn if

speaker: GOBBO
text: thou be Lancelet, thou art mine own flesh and

speaker: GOBBO
text: blood. Lord worshiped might He be, what a beard

speaker: GOBBO
text: hast thou got! Thou hast got more hair on thy chin

speaker: GOBBO
text: than Dobbin my fill-horse has on his tail.

speaker: LANCELET
text: It should seem, then, that

speaker: LANCELET
text: Dobbin’s tail grows backward. I am sure he had

speaker: LANCELET
text: more hair of his tail than I have of my face when I

speaker: LANCELET
text: last saw him.

speaker: GOBBO
text: Lord, how art thou changed! How dost thou

speaker: GOBBO
text: and thy master agree? I have brought him a present.

speaker: GOBBO
text: How ’gree you now?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Well, well. But for mine own part, as I have

speaker: LANCELET
text: set up my rest to run away, so I will not rest till I

speaker: LANCELET
text: have run some ground. My master’s a very Jew.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Give him a present! Give him a halter. I am

speaker: LANCELET
text: famished in his service. You may tell every finger I

speaker: LANCELET
text: have with my ribs. Father, I am glad you are come!

speaker: LANCELET
text: Give me your present to one Master Bassanio, who

speaker: LANCELET
text: indeed gives rare new liveries. If I serve not him, I

speaker: LANCELET
text: will run as far as God has any ground. O rare

speaker: LANCELET
text: fortune, here comes the man! To him, father, for I

speaker: LANCELET
text: am a Jew if I serve the Jew any longer.

speaker: BASSANIO
text: You may do so, but let it be

speaker: BASSANIO
text: so hasted that supper be ready at the farthest by five

speaker: BASSANIO
text: of the clock. See these letters delivered, put the

speaker: BASSANIO
text: liveries to making, and desire Gratiano to come

speaker: BASSANIO
text: anon to my lodging.

speaker: LANCELET
text: To him, father.

speaker: GOBBO
text: God bless your Worship.

speaker: BASSANIO
text: Gramercy. Wouldst thou aught with me?

speaker: GOBBO
text: Here’s my son, sir, a poor boy—

speaker: LANCELET
text: Not a poor boy, sir, but the rich Jew’s man,

speaker: LANCELET
text: that would, sir, as my father shall specify—

speaker: GOBBO
text: He hath a great infection, sir, as one would say,

speaker: GOBBO
text: to serve—

speaker: LANCELET
text: Indeed, the short and the long is, I serve the

speaker: LANCELET
text: Jew, and have a desire, as my father shall specify—

speaker: GOBBO
text: His master and he (saving your Worship’s

speaker: GOBBO
text: reverence) are scarce cater-cousins—

speaker: LANCELET
text: To be brief, the very truth is that the Jew,

speaker: LANCELET
text: having done me wrong, doth cause me, as my

speaker: LANCELET
text: father being, I hope, an old man, shall frutify unto

speaker: LANCELET
text: you—

speaker: GOBBO
text: I have here a dish of doves that I would bestow

speaker: GOBBO
text: upon your Worship, and my suit is—

speaker: LANCELET
text: In very brief, the suit is impertinent to

speaker: LANCELET
text: myself, as your Worship shall know by this honest

speaker: LANCELET
text: old man, and though I say it, though old man yet

speaker: LANCELET
text: poor man, my father—

speaker: BASSANIO
text: One speak for both. What would you?

speaker: LANCELET
text: Serve you, sir.

speaker: GOBBO
text: That is the very defect of the matter, sir.

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
I
               
              know
               
              thee
               
              well
              .
               
              Thou
               
              hast
               
              obtained
               
              thy
               
              suit
              .

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
Shylock
               
              thy
               
              master
               
              spoke
               
              with
               
              me
               
              this
               
              day
              ,

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
And
               
              hath
               
              preferred
               
              thee
              ,
               
              if
               
              it
               
              be
               
              preferment

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
To
               
              leave
               
              a
               
              rich
               
              Jew’s
               
              service
              ,
               
              to
               
              become

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
The
               
              follower
               
              of
               
              so
               
              poor
               
              a
               
              gentleman
              .

speaker: LANCELET
text: The old proverb is very well parted between

speaker: LANCELET
text: my master Shylock and you, sir: you have “the

speaker: LANCELET
text: grace of God,” sir, and he hath “enough.”

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
Thou
               
              speak’st
               
              it
               
              well
              .
              —
              Go
              ,
               
              father
              ,
               
              with
               
              thy
               
              son
              .
              —

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
Take
               
              leave
               
              of
               
              thy
               
              old
               
              master
              ,
               
              and
               
              inquire

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
My
               
              lodging
               
              out
              .
              
                 
                To
                 
                an
                 
                Attendant
                .
              
               
              Give
               
              him
               
              a
               
              livery

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
More
               
              guarded
               
              than
               
              his
               
              fellows’
              .
               
              See
               
              it
               
              done
              .

speaker: LANCELET
text: Father, in. I cannot get a service, no! I have

speaker: LANCELET
text: ne’er a tongue in my head! Well,

speaker: LANCELET
text: if any man in Italy have a fairer table which doth

speaker: LANCELET
text: offer to swear upon a book—I shall have good

speaker: LANCELET
text: fortune, go to! Here’s a simple line of life. Here’s a

speaker: LANCELET
text: small trifle of wives—alas, fifteen wives is nothing;

speaker: LANCELET
text: eleven widows and nine maids is a simple coming-in

speaker: LANCELET
text: for one man—and then to ’scape drowning

speaker: LANCELET
text: thrice, and to be in peril of my life with the edge of a

speaker: LANCELET
text: featherbed! Here are simple ’scapes. Well, if Fortune

speaker: LANCELET
text: be a woman, she’s a good wench for this gear.

speaker: LANCELET
text: Father, come. I’ll take my leave of the Jew in the

speaker: LANCELET
text: twinkling.

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
I
               
              pray
               
              thee
              ,
               
              good
               
              Leonardo
              ,
               
              think
               
              on
               
              this
              .

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
These
               
              things
               
              being
               
              bought
               
              and
               
              orderly
               
              bestowed
              ,

speaker: BASSANIO

Return
               
              in
               
              haste
              ,
               
              for
               
              I

              feast

speaker: BASSANIO

My
               
              best
               
              esteemed
               
              acquaintance
              .
               
              Hie
               
              thee
              ,
               
              go
              .

speaker: LEONARDO

My
               
              best

              shall
               
              be

              herein
              .

speaker: GRATIANO
text: Where’s your master?

speaker: LEONARDO
text: Yonder, sir, he walks.

speaker: GRATIANO
text: Signior Bassanio!

speaker: BASSANIO
text: Gratiano!

speaker: GRATIANO
text: I have suit to you.

speaker: BASSANIO
text: You have obtained it.

speaker: GRATIANO
text: You must not deny me. I must go with you

speaker: GRATIANO
text: to Belmont.

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
Why
               
              then
               
              you

              .
               
              But
               
              hear
               
              thee
              ,
               
              Gratiano
              ,

speaker: BASSANIO

Thou
               
              art
               
              too

              ,

              of

              —

speaker: BASSANIO

Parts
               
              that
               
              become
               
              thee

              enough
              ,

speaker: BASSANIO
text:
And
               
              in

              as
               
              ours

              not
               
              faults
              .

But

              —
              why
              ,

Something
               
              too

speaker: BASSANIO

To

Thy

              spirit
              ,

I
               
              be

Signior

              hood

Like
